item.title: 即使费用攀升，美国液化天然气生产商的合同量仍接近创纪录水平
item.description: 尽管业界对产能增加和成本上升感到担忧，但美国液化天然气开发商今年有望签订第二多的年度约束性销售合同。【原文：U.S. liquefied natural gas developers are on track this year to ink the second-highest annual number of binding sales contracts, despite industry concerns about increasing capacity and rising costs.】

item.title: 特斯拉投资者投票决定向马斯克支付 8,780 亿美元--但这还不是全部
item.description: 特斯拉股东将于周四决定是否向首席执行官埃隆-马斯克支付高达 8,780 亿美元的薪酬，这是历史上最丰厚的高管薪酬。【原文：Tesla shareholders will decide on Thursday whether to pay CEO Elon Musk up to $878 billion, the richest executive pay in history by a long shot.】

item.title: 人工智能股票波动表明美国市场对科技的依赖
item.description: 本周与人工智能有关的股票的震荡，鲜明地提醒人们，美国股市越来越依赖科技行业来推动其走高。【原文：This week's wobble in shares connected to artificial intelligence is a stark reminder that the U.S. stock market is ever more reliant on the technology sector to drive it higher.】

item.title: 新投资计划令投资者不安，DoorDash 股价下跌
item.description: DoorDash股价在周四的盘前交易中下跌近9%，原因是该公司面对成本压力，积极计划在2026年再投资数亿美元，这让投资者感到不安。【原文：DoorDash shares dropped nearly 9% in premarket trading on Thursday as the company's aggressive plan to invest several hundred million dollars more in 2026 in the face of cost pressures unnerved investors.】

item.title: 挑战者公司数据显示，美国10月份裁员人数激增至二十年来新高
item.description: Challenger, Gray & Christmas 公司周四发布报告称，随着各行各业采用人工智能驱动的变革并加大成本削减力度，10 月份美国雇主削减了超过 15 万个工作岗位，创下了 20 多年来的最大降幅。【原文：U.S.-based employers cut more than 150,000 jobs in October, marking the biggest reduction for the month in more than 20 years, a report by Challenger, Gray & Christmas said on Thursday as industries adopt AI-driven changes and intensify cost cuts.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息称 Prosus 对德国汽车市场 Mobile.de 表现出早期兴趣
item.description: 据三位熟知内情的人士透露，荷兰技术投资集团 Prosus 在 Mobile.de 的所有者准备出售这家德国在线汽车市场集团股份之际，表达了可能竞购 Mobile.de 的早期兴趣。【原文：Dutch technology investment group Prosus has expressed early-stage interest in potentially bidding for Mobile.de as the owners prepare to sell shares in the German online auto marketplace group, according to three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 独家报道：谷歌亚马逊植树造林交易使巴西初创公司成为其顶级碳信用额供应商
item.description: 谷歌达成了最大的碳清除协议，同意与巴西初创公司 Mombak 合作，为亚马逊雨林的恢复提供资金。【原文：Google has struck its biggest carbon removal deal, agreeing to finance restoration of the Amazon rainforest with Brazilian startup Mombak, as big tech hunts for high-quality credits to offset emissions tied to energy-hungry data centers.】

item.title: 韩国官员质疑在美国造船厂建造核潜艇的可行性
item.description: 韩国总理金珉奭周四在国会听证会上表示，韩国在美国拥有的菲利造船厂目前不具备建造核动力潜艇的能力。【原文：The South Korean-owned Philly Shipyard in the United States does not currently have the capability to build a nuclear-powered submarine, Prime Minister Kim Min-seok said on Thursday during a parliamentary hearing.】

item.title: 谷歌将于周二宣布在德国的最大一笔投资
item.description: 谷歌周四表示，它将于周二与德国财政部长拉尔斯-克林拜尔（Lars Klingbeil）一起宣布其在德国有史以来最大的投资计划。【原文：Google said on Thursday that it is to announce its biggest-ever investment plan for Germany on Tuesday alongside German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil.】

item.title: 德国金融监管机构对摩根大通处以创纪录的 5200 万美元罚款
item.description: 德国金融监管机构 BaFin 对总部位于法兰克福的摩根大通 SE 处以 4500 万欧元（5250 万美元）的史上最大罚金，原因是摩根大通 SE 在防止洗钱方面存在缺陷。【原文：Germany's financial watchdog BaFin has imposed its largest-ever fine of 45 million euros ($52.5 million) on Frankfurt-based JPMorgan SE for deficiencies in money-laundering prevention.】

item.title: 印度 IT 公司 Mphasis 首席执行官称银行是收入增长的动力
item.description: 由 Blackstone 支持的印度 IT 服务公司 Mphasis 首席执行官表示，预计其关键的金融部门将在截至 3 月底的六个月内推动销售额的增长，预计收入增长速度将是同行业的两倍多。【原文：Blackstone -backed Indian IT services firm Mphasis expects its key financial segment to drive sales in the six months through March end, its CEO said, with revenue projected to grow at more than twice the industry's pace.】

item.title: 埃克森美孚加入希腊近海天然气勘探项目
item.description: 美国石油巨头埃克森美孚公司（ExxonMobil）周四表示，该公司已与Energean公司和Helleniq能源公司签署协议，在希腊近海勘探天然气。【原文：U.S. oil giant ExxonMobil has signed a deal with Energean and Helleniq Energy to explore for natural gas offshore Greece, the companies said on Thursday.】

item.title: 葡萄牙 EDP 公司将在 2026-28 年投资 140 亿美元，重点关注美国增长
item.description: 葡萄牙最大的公用事业公司 EDP 周四表示，计划在 2026 年至 2028 年间投资 120 亿欧元（约合 139.9 亿美元），主要用于扩大可再生能源发电能力，重点是美国。【原文：Portugal's largest utility, EDP , plans to invest 12 billion euros ($13.99 billion) between 2026 and 2028, mainly to expand its renewable capacity with a focus on the United States, the company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 法国向欧盟施压，要求调查谢因性玩具和武器事件
item.description: 法国周四向欧盟施加了更大压力，要求欧盟对中国在线快速时尚零售商申银万国在其市场上销售类似儿童的性玩偶和违禁武器一事展开正式调查。【原文：France on Thursday increased pressure on the European Union to launch a formal investigation into Chinese online fast-fashion retailer Shein over the sale of child-like sex dolls and banned weapons on its marketplace.】

item.title: 中粮集团举行大豆采购签约仪式，协会官员出席中美论坛
item.description: 中国一家农业企业协会的负责人在一个美中论坛上说，中国国有企业中粮集团周四上午举行了大豆采购签约仪式。【原文：China's state-owned COFCO held a soybean procurement signing ceremony on Thursday morning, the head of a Chinese agriculture business association told a U.S.-China forum.】

item.title: 独家报道：谷歌计划在澳大利亚印度洋前哨建立强大的人工智能数据中心
item.description: 根据路透社查阅的文件和对官员的采访，谷歌计划在澳大利亚偏远的印度洋前哨圣诞岛建立一个大型人工智能数据中心，今年早些时候，谷歌与国防部签署了一份云协议。【原文：Google plans to build a large artificial intelligence data centre on Australia's remote Indian Ocean outpost of Christmas Island after signing a cloud deal with the Department of Defence earlier this year, according to documents reviewed by Reuters and interviews with officials.】

item.title: 日产汽车季度运营利润实现两位数增长
item.description: 周四，日产汽车公布第二季度营业利润同比增长 61%，原因是作为其扭亏为盈计划的一部分，降低固定成本的努力帮助其避免了亏损。【原文：Nissan Motor posted a 61% rise in second-quarter operating profit from a year earlier on Thursday as efforts to reduce fixed costs as part of its turnaround plan helped it avoid a loss.】

item.title: 自 10 月 13 日起，Nexperia 无法保证中国制造芯片的质量
item.description: 计算机芯片制造商 Nexperia 公司周四表示，公司控制权危机有望得到解决，但该公司警告客户，公司无法保证 10 月 13 日之后在中国生产的产品是正品并符合质量标准。【原文：Computer chipmaker Nexperia expects to resolve a crisis over control of the company, it said on Thursday, but warned customers it cannot guarantee products made in China after October 13 are authentic and meet quality standards.】

item.title: 阿斯利康维持预期，癌症和心脏病药物提升收益
item.description: 阿斯利康公司周四公布的第三季度财报超出预期，其癌症和心血管药物大片销售强劲，但未上调全年业绩预期，令一些投资者感到失望。【原文：AstraZeneca beat expectations for third quarter earnings on Thursday with strong sales of its blockbuster cancer and cardiovascular drugs, but disappointed some investors by not raising its full-year forecasts.】

item.title: 消息人士称，KKR 和新加坡电信寻求通过 39 亿美元的交易完全控股新加坡数据中心公司
item.description: 两位直接了解该计划的人士称，KKR & Co 和新加坡电信公司正在就以超过 50 亿新元（39 亿美元）的价格收购 ST Telemedia Global Data Centres 超过 80% 的股份（这将使他们获得全部所有权）进行深入谈判。【原文：KKR & Co and Singapore Telecommunications are in advanced talks to buy more than 80% of ST Telemedia Global Data Centres - which would give them full ownership - for over S$5 billion ($3.9 billion), two people with direct knowledge of the plans said.】

item.title: 卫星公司 SES 盈利不及预期，Intelsat 整合带来压力
item.description: 欧洲卫星公司 SES 周四公布的第三季度核心利润低于预期，受最近收购 Intelsat 的整合成本影响。【原文：European satellite company SES reported a lower than expected core profit for the third quarter on Thursday, weighed down by integration costs of its recent acquisition of Intelsat.】

item.title: 沃尔沃汽车公司战略调整，目标营业利润率超过 8
item.description: 沃尔沃汽车公司（Volvo Cars）周四表示，该公司正在进行战略调整，目标是将长期营业利润率提高到 8%以上，同时深化与大股东吉利汽车公司（GEELY.UL）的合作，以削减成本，实现强劲的正现金流。【原文：Volvo Cars said on Thursday that it was targeting a long-term operating profit margin of over 8% in a strategy overhaul, deepening its cooperation with majority owner Geely (GEELY.UL) to cut costs and enable a strong positive cash flow.】

item.title: 特朗普最高法院在关税问题上的失败将增加贸易的不确定性
item.description: 美国最高法院对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的全球关税提出了严厉的质疑，这加剧了人们对这些关税将被取消的猜测，但也引发了更多混乱的担忧，因为人们普遍预计，在不利裁决之后，特朗普将转向其他贸易策略。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court's tough questioning of President Donald Trump's global tariffs fueled increased speculation that they will be struck down, but raised the specter of additional chaos as he is widely expected to shift to other trade tactics in the wake of an adverse ruling.】

item.title: 支付公司 Worldline 计划注资 5 亿欧元
item.description: 法国支付公司 Worldline 周四表示，该公司计划筹集 5 亿欧元（5.83 亿美元）新股，以支持一项扭亏为盈计划，并在经历多年挑战后重建投资者信心。【原文：French payments firm Worldline said on Thursday it plans to raise 500 million euros ($583 million) in fresh equity to support a turnaround plan and rebuild investor confidence after years of challenges.】

item.title: 据《德国商报》报道，谷歌将宣布有史以来在德国最大的投资计划
item.description: 据商业新闻媒体《Handelsblatt》周四报道，美国科技巨头谷歌计划下周提交其在德国有史以来最大的投资计划。【原文：U.S. tech giant Google plans to present its largest-ever investment plan for Germany next week, business news outlet Handelsblatt reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 早间竞价聚焦刀锋般的英国央行决议
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 独家报道贸易商称中国在领导人会晤后购买两船美国小麦
item.description: 两位贸易商周四告诉路透社，继上周两国领导人会晤后，中国已购买了两批美国小麦，总计约 12 万吨，12 月份装运。【原文：China has purchased two cargoes of U.S. wheat totalling around 120,000 tons for December shipment following last week's meeting between the two countries' leaders, two traders told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国 10 月份出口放缓，因为对美国加征关税的前置条件有所缓解：路透社民调
item.description: 中国 10 月份的出口增长可能有所放缓，原因是海外订单在经过数月的前置处理以抵御美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的关税之后有所减少，同时买家也在观望中美贸易关系动荡的一个月将如何发展。【原文：China's export growth probably slowed in October, as overseas orders tapered off following months of front-loading to beat U.S. President Donald Trump's tariffs, and as buyers watched to see how a volatile month in U.S.-China trade ties would develop.】

item.title: 土耳其航空公司与通用电气航空航天集团达成 75 架波音飞机发动机协议
item.description: 土耳其航空公司已与通用电气航空航天公司达成协议，为其从波音公司购买的 75 架 B787 飞机采购发动机、备用发动机和发动机维护服务。【原文：Turkish Airlines has reached an agreement with GE Aerospace to procure engines, spare engines, and engine maintenance services for 75 B787 planes that it is buying from Boeing, the company said.】

item.title: MSCI 将把 Paytm 和其他三只印度股票纳入旗舰全球指数
item.description: 摩根士丹利资本国际公司（MSCI）周三晚些时候表示，作为季度审查的一部分，该公司将把四家印度上市公司（包括富通医疗保健和金融科技公司 Paytm）纳入全球标准指数（Global Standard Indexes），并于 11 月 24 日生效。【原文：MSCI will add four India-listed companies, including Fortis Healthcare and fintech firm Paytm , to Global Standard Indexes as part of its quarterly review effective November 24, the index provider said late Wednesday.】
